author: AmandaCameron
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->
## Steps to reproduce

Attempt to build PowerShell on macOS Seirra.
## Expected behavior

PowerShell builds.
## Actual behavior

Bunch of nasty errors about unsupported runtime `osx.10.12-x64` -- adding that to the sets, and the various `package.json`s results in a cryptic build output: https://gist.github.com/AmandaCameron/5e088a8fbae1f1f8b95f737133fca08c
## Environment data

(Not sure it matters, but: )

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

``` powershell
> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
PSEdition                      Core
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.10
CLRVersion
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @AmandaCameron can you verify that both CoreCLR, CoreFX, and .NET CLI all support OS X 10.12 now?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Confirmed that .NET does not yet support 10.12. I'm going to close this as there is nothing we can do until our language gets supported on this platform (_please do re-open as soon as that's the case_). Thanks!

title: Fails to build on macOS Seirra
